p: Durant-Archibold et al. [ 17] described the use of infusions of leaves and roots of Piper peltatum in Brazil traditional medicine to treat erysipela, malaria, leishmaniasis and hepatitis. Peoples in the Amazon region and other parts of South America traditionally used the infusions of P. peltatum root to treat malaria [ 216]. In Brazil, particularly, infusions of the roots and/or leaves of P. peltatum are used in the treatment of malaria, erisipela (a skin ailment caused by Staphylococcus spp.), hepatitis, and leishmaniasis [ 217].
